code.title: Neural Network to Play 2048
code.desc: A reinforcement learning bot written in python that learns to play 2048 from the experience gained from playing it again and again. This project was done for my 6th semester Machine Learning course at Manipal Institute of Technology. The neural network for this project was written from scratch including the TD backpropagation algorithm.

code.title: Particle.js
code.desc: Particle.js is a JavaScript canvas library for fancy particle animations. The fun animations you see on the main page of this website use Particle.js at its core. You can checkout another implementation of particle.js at Headout's careers page.

code.title: SVG Path Parser
code.desc: SVG path parser is a custom path 2D parser written specifically for Particle.JS to support animation for any path. Particle.JS requires path length and nth point for each path element that is created in a path 2D, for this very reason I had to write a custom parser that converts those path elements into custom path functions which provide its length and a method to get the nth point on the path.

code.title: IE CSE Website 2014-2015
code.desc:
IE CSE is the official computer science club of manipal. Every year IE CSE hosts a website winter project for its new members to rebuild their website. This is the 2014-2015 version of the website.
Checkout the live version!

code.title: Hospital Management System
code.desc: A hospital management system for a charitable hospital based in Haridwar, India. Over the span of two years (2012-2013) I developed various modules including registration, inventory management, appointment scheduling, patient data maintenance etc, delivering a complete and integrated hospital management system written in .NET Framework and Microsoft SQL Server.

about:
Hi!I'm Karan.

At the age of 9, I saw my father engrossed in a bright white screen with incomprehensible letters scattered all over. Curiously, I went to him and asked what he was doing. His answer proved to be one of the most profound and enlightening moments of my life, the day I was introduced to programming languages and computer science. From the years that followed, nights spent writing code instead of completing homework, it was pretty much set in stone that I would do nothing but this for the rest of my life. By the time I became an adolescent, I cultivated a sense of direction and autodidactism. Whether it was teaching myself to play the guitar, coming up with my own chess openings to beat my grandfather or understanding the perplexing piece of our biological machine that is the human brain through psychology.

India produces more than 160,000 engineers specializing in Information Technology and Computer science every year. Each one of us has the desire to be unique. There’s an anxiety in all of us, of being hailed as just another sheep in the flock. I’m no greater than what evolution has made me. In the pursuit of greatness and success, I believe it is my passion and the eternal hunger for knowledge that will set me apart.

Connect with me on LinkedIn.
